title: Foxconn to Build Cars for Electric-Vehicle Startup Fisker
sub_head: Companies to produce more than 250,000 vehicles a year under deal
body:
BREAKING NEWS
*Foxconn and Fisker Considering U.S. Locations to Make New Jointly-Developed Car, Fisker CEO Says
*’Very Good Chance’ Existing Foxconn Factory in Wisconsin Could Be Used for Car Production in 2023, Fisker CEO Says
Story will be updated
Foxconn Technology Group , the world’s biggest electronics contract manufacturer, has agreed to assemble cars for electric-vehicle startup Fisker Inc., the latest deal for the Apple iPhone assembler in its eager expansion into the automotive sector over the past year.
